title: Daily reminder that Xerath has not gotten a skin since April 2015.
body:
I understand that a champion's popularity is a huge factor in how many skins it gets, but this is just ridiculous. You could do so much with him. There's so much potential to make a quality skin here.

Sad part is, if they release something like Dark Star Xerath and it turns out to be amazing, people would still say something like "Why Xerath?". This is exactly why we get 25 Lux/Ahri/Akali/Jinx/Ezreal/Miss Fortune skins each year. Then when we get those, people still complain about that. It's like a cycle of confusion and people don't know what they want but they still open their wallets.

According to LeagueOfGraphs in the last 2 years, Xerath has had a play rate of 5%-7%. Dipping a bit in 2017 to around 4%.

In that same timeframe according to the same website, Ziggs who has had 3 skins since 2017 (that being Arcade, Odyssey which could be earned by playing and one in the coming weeks) has had a play rate of 2-3%. He's currently at 1.5% vs Xerath's 5%.

Explain how he's bland? Miss Fortune/Ezreal/Ahri are bland other than the fact they're physically attractive. Tell me how Xerath's design is bland. Go more in depth.
Xerath is literally a bundle of energy plus a few accessories. How is that NOT bland? It's like trying to argue that Zac isn't a bland design.
Because human designs are so creative and interesting. At least Xerath is unique. We have at least 13 MFs in LOL.

Unique /= Imaginative

You're right, a lightning stick figure is unique. It's also hella uninspired. Xerath's design is so damn boring that I'm surprised he hasn't gotten a rework yet.
He looks cool. His game model is just outdated. A transcended mage of immense power trapped in a broken sarcophagus doesnt feel boring to me. We have Gragas and Sylas smh.
In so many words you're literally agreeing that he needs an update to his design lol
Design and outdated model are same things to you? In so many words, you don't know what you are talking about.
Improving his model would be improving his design, guv. Which would also mean giving the design team more to work with when thinking up skin ideas.
I dont mean a Morde VGU, I mean a Maokai VGU. His design isnt boring to me.

Maokai's design isn't bland, though. And because of his updated model (which created more details) they are able to do more with the champ's design. **The same thing would happen with Xerath**. His model is dookie af consisting of simple polygons. To update that model would be to include more shapes that can be adjusted for skins. You can only do so much with polygons wearing plates that doesn't look similar to every other polygons wearing plates.

With design are you implying "a being of energy surrounded by a shattered sarcophagus" or his model being not detailed enough? Because with design, I answer on the former one. I don't think a being of energy and stone is bland. What bland may be how they handled it and it is okay since he is 2012 champion. I would like a Xerath VGU, not a Xerath replacement.

Well, I'm looking at it from a developmental standpoint. When a model is updated it's coding and polygons are updated as well. To update Xerath's model would be not only to increase it's quality but also to adjust it's particles, polygons, and the total amount of moving parts. They can add more parts that are there but hardly noticed. As you've mentioned, he's a 2012 champ--that's almost 8 years ago. Just look at Sejuani. They didn't change her design, they *updated* it. They kept the same look just gave it a better model. Well, for Classic anyway.

I think Dark Star would be perfect for him. It doesn't matter if he's a celestial style being. Void monsters are (metaphorically) aliens themselves, so why did Kha and Cho get Dark Star skins? 

One I can immediately think off the top of my head would be Mecha Zero Xerath.

When his Passive procs, he glows for a second.
His Q can be an orange lightning (like the actual lightning we see in the sky).
His W can be a roaring thunder falling from the sky and it actually makes a sound effect like this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ult4hwTpkhg
His E can be him firing his arm (like the same idea of iBlitzcrank shooting his arm)
His R can be him transforming into something else (same idea as Mecha Zero Sion when he ults) while he's in his Ascended form firing the Arcane bolts.

I can also see Arcade Xerath working.

But they aren't celestial beings in any sort, so those skins suit them. Xerath is literally made of energy so it's a lazy redundant design to make that. All of the champions that have those don't have a celestial feeling in their base skins. Cho was also a special case as he was made as part of a Make A Wish gift to a player.

Arcade would have been nice on him.
